title: Go-To-Market Intern (f/m/x) (Earliest start March 2024)
content:
Become part of Tanso and leverage your sales expertise for climate impact.
Join our team to take an active role in helping companies to decarbonize effectively and start your career in a fast-growing environment. Your main objective is to ensure that our sales processes scale with the demand we experience and that we hit our ambitious goals.
As our Go-To-Market Intern, you help us to build and continuously improve our company processes, together with our CEO, our Sales Lead and Go-to-Market Manager. Your focus will be building up our sales pipeline and interacting with potential buyers of our software.
How you succeed
üìàLearn how to sell software

Work hands-on with our sales team, experiencing how SaaS sales work.
Proactively contact potential customers via all channels.
Prepare and develop our internal documents, such as sales pitches or call scripts.

üéØHelp to redefine our go-to-market

Closely work with our CEO and Sales Lead monitoring our market and competitive landscape.
Launch test balloons with Marketing to generate more inbound leads.

ü™ÅSpace to bring in your ideas

Proactively take responsibility for making Tanso a better company.

Whom you will be working with

Till, CEO, one of our founders, who is currently running most of our sales efforts and leads the business strategy
Tina, Go-to-market Manager, who is currently ramping up our growth engine, from structuring Hubspot to creating marketing campaigns
Raffael, Sales Lead
Sales Team

Recruitment Process

Culture & Personal Fit with Saskia or Mauritz - get to know Tanso and ask all your questions
Role Introduction with Till or Raffael - understand your role and see who you will be working with

Job Requirements
You're wondering why there isn't a list of concrete skill requirements in the job description? We believe it's more important that you are excited about the role and want to grow with it, instead of fulfilling some specific high-level requirements. We think there can be numerous different paths that could qualify you for this role, and we want to hear YOUR story.
However, to ensure we can communicate effectively with our customers, your language proficiency in German should be at least level C1 or higher.

questions.label: Why do you want to join Tanso
What skills and experiences will you be able to leverage when tackling the challenges that you will face in your role at Tanso?
Is there something else that you want us to know?
Are you legally authorized to work in the European Union?
Do you speak German? If yes, on what level (A1-C2)?
Did anyone refer or recommend you for this position (please add the full name or an email address)?
